content.description: A fun crack that features hands, fists, and a little bit of face climbing.
content.protection: Take an assorted rack up to number 4. Some leaders may want two number 3s. For a top anchor take very long slings and/or some small gear. There is a small crack and a very large horn at the top.
content.location: Located to the right of False Determination. Next to the Zanzibar Boulder.

content.description: Start on the big flake and do really fun and easy climbing to a jug below the huge pod. Pull into the pod and place your first piece. Enjoy a solid no hands rest and then get into the big undercling and charge up the layback section that ends with solid hands. A really fun climb and a must do.
content.protection: Big gear for the pod (6). Small gear for the initial layback section then good hand sized pieces. Anchor I used a 4, 3, and 2.
content.location: The dihedral corner crack to the left of False Determination.

content.description:
Begin by laying on the boulder all the way under the roof.  Climb out and up with burly pulls on tricky jams. This is the full value start to this route.  

  One can easily skip the 15' of totally horizontal beginning moves by just reaching up where the horizontal break turns vert. Still stout and fun!
This is a highball crack problem found in a dihedral. Jam and stem your way to the top. Scramble off to the West (climbers left).
content.protection: Tricky landing area. Can be done roped. It's best not to fall if you decide to boulder it.
content.location: Located on Zilch Wall to the climber's left (West) of False Determination.

content.description: A tall area frequented by rappellers, this South facing wall hosts a few moderates
